availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Benjamin P. Duvall (Franklin County, Kentucky, physician )

body.p: Franklin County, Kentucky, physician. Kentucky native. Married to Julia A. Duvall. Father of Benjamin F. Duvall, Cornelius H. Duvall, Marien M. Duvall, William H. Duvall, Joseph P. Duvall, Martha J. Duvall, and Susan M. Duvall. Physician in Franklin County, Kentucky, in 1850. Owned five enslaved persons in Franklin County in 1850. Owned Marilda [Unknown] in Franklin County in 1855. Owned Gemima [Unknown] in Franklin County in 1858. Physician in Franklin County in 1860. Owned seven enslaved persons in Franklin County in 1860.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Franklin County, District 1, p. 17A.
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Franklin County, District 1, p. 835.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Franklin County, District 1, p. 167-8.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Franklin County, District 1, p. 481B.
Kentucky Birth, Marriage and Death Records (1852-1910), KDLA, Frankfort, KY, Roll 994034, Franklin County Births.
Kentucky, Wills and Probate Records, 1774-1989, Kentucky County, District, and Probate Courts, Franklin County Administrators Bonds, 1824-1840.
